definitions.definition: A paved part of road , usually in a village or a town .
examples: Walk down the street until you see a hotel on the right.
The man wearing a red coat is standing on the street .

definitions.definition: A road as above, but including the sidewalks ( pavements ) and buildings .
examples: I live on the street down from Joyce Avenue.

definitions.definition: The roads that run perpendicular to avenues in a grid layout.

subdefinitions.definition: The people who live in such a road, as a neighborhood .
The people who spend a great deal of time on the street in urban areas, especially, the young , the poor , the unemployed , and those engaged in illegal activities.
An illicit or contraband source , especially of drugs .
examples: I got some pot cheap on the street .
The seized drugs had a street value of $5 million.
Orders were reported to have increased 2% monthly, ahead of the 1.2% expected by the street .
Professional services and other revenue made up $577 million, edging out street estimates for $541.4 million.

definitions.definition: People in general, as a source of information .

examples: He's streets ahead of his sister in all the subjects in school.

definitions.definition: Each of the three opportunities that players have to bet, after the flop , turn and river .
A style of skateboarding featuring typically urban obstacles .

main_definition: A paved part of road , usually in a village or a town .
secondary_definitions: A road as above, but including the sidewalks ( pavements ) and buildings .
( specifically , US ) The roads that run perpendicular to avenues in a grid layout.
( slang , in the plural ) People in general, as a source of information .
( poker slang ) Each of the three opportunities that players have to bet, after the flop , turn and river .
( uncountable , sports ) A style of skateboarding featuring typically urban obstacles .
